documenttitle.text: Red Hat Security Advisory: idm:DL1 security update

note.text:
An update for the idm:DL1 module is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
note.title: Topic

note.text:
Red Hat Identity Management (IdM) is a centralized authentication, identity management, and authorization solution for both traditional and cloud-based enterprise environments. 

Security Fix(es):

* samba: Samba AD DC did not always rely on the SID and PAC in Kerberos tickets (CVE-2020-25719)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank Andrew Bartlett for reporting this issue. Upstream acknowledges the Samba project as the original reporter.
